wso2.api.publisher.enables.api.providers: WSO2 API Publisher enables API providers to publish APIs, share documentation, provision API keys and gather feedback on features, quality and usage. To get started, Create an API or Publish a sample API.
try.dropping.some.files.here.or.click.to: Try dropping some files here, or click to select files to upload.
Use an existing API endpoint or the API Swagger definition to create an API
Use an existing SOAP endpoint to create a managed API. Import the WSDL of the SOAP service
design.a.new.rest.api.using.wsdl: Design a new REST API using WSDL
design.and.prototype.a.new.rest.api: Design and prototype a new REST API
fill.the.mandatory.fields: Fill the mandatory fields (Name, Version, Context) and create the API. Configure advanced configurations later.
design.and.prototype.a.new.websocket.api: Design and prototype a new Websocket API
name: Name
version.helper.text: **Version input is not support in this release
select.a.plan.for.the.api.and.enable.api: Select a plan for the API and enable API level throttling.
you.can.define.endpoint.inline.or.pick.f: You can define endpoint inline or pick from a list of global endpoints
global.endpoints.can.be.only.edited.from: Global endpoints can be only edited from Global Endpoint Page
here.you.can.only.attach.a.global.endpoi: Here you can only attach a global endpoint to API.
create.scope.description: Scopes enable fine-grained access control to API resources based on user roles. You define scopes to an API's resources. When a user invokes the API, his/her OAuth 2 bearer token cannot grant access to any API resource beyond its associated scopes.
